name: Sarcoptic Mange
description: A highly contagious skin disease caused by the Sarcoptes scabiei mite. It leads to intense itching, hair loss, and crusted skin.

stages.Early: Red bumps and intense scratching, typically on ears, elbows, and belly.
stages.Advanced: Widespread hair loss, thickened and crusted skin, and potential for secondary bacterial infections.

causes: Direct contact with an infected animal or contaminated bedding.
risk_factors: Exposure to stray animals, crowded living conditions (like shelters), and a weakened immune system.
preventive_measures: Avoid contact with infected animals and their environment. Regular veterinary check-ups.
solution: Veterinarian-prescribed medications such as selamectin, ivermectin, or moxidectin. Medicated baths may also be recommended to soothe the skin.
